Why did they "rule" the localities? Put most simply, they were armed. Durin=
g the Do-ikki of the later 15th Century, they were still agriculturalists (=
either as minor owners or cultivators), but had the advantage of being arme=
d (perhaps not to the level of samurai retained by local daimyo), placing t=
hem slightly higher up the scale to the average peasant with mud on his fee=
t. This was undoubtedly one of the reasons ashigaru and samurai were not pe=
rmitted to return to their home villages by the statutes of Toyotomi Hideyo=
shi, since they gave an element of martial skill to rural discontent.
